ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about alternative energy sources, greener sources of energy (mainly solar), and a lot about the current climate crisis.
The course was a survey of alternative energy technologies, with an emphasis on DSSCs.

I learned a bunch about the different renewable energies out there. Solar energy was the main focus especially in Brudvig and Batista's lectures. I have a greater understanding of the mechanisms behind solar energy and current research endeavors.
DSSC's, I-V curves, Photosystem II, Marcus theory
Learnt more on solar energy and other types of renewables.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Having all the different instructors was helpful for looking at the issues from different perspectives.
I enjoyed the material and the different perspective provided by each instructor. Course was a little disjointed since it consisted of 4 separate units.

Strengths: All four professors are experts in the field and very excited to talk about their research. They are all willing to occur help on various assignments. This is truly a "real world application" class Weaknesses: Sometimes outside research (google) is needed to supplement lecture learning, but it is readily available.

strengths - very relevant topic. It got me excited about ways that chemists can help solve energy related problems. weaknesses- disorganized. some professors covered the same topic. Each section was taught so differently that it was hard to adjust to each professor's style
Strength is in getting knowledge from different professors. However, too much content so hard to absorb everything taught.
Learning from 4 different professors provided the students with varied perspectives and approaches to the energy problem.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's very informative and the time commitment is not too bad.
Yes. All four professors are super fun, unique in their own ways, and very passionate about the topic. Truly experts in the field, and you will quickly become one.
yes because it's such an important topic, but not necessarily because the class is run well.
Yes, would recommend if interested in alternative energy.
I would recommend this course to anyone working in photovoltaics, electrochemistry, or any related field
